Legal_Issue: Whether the expulsion officer erred in refusing to defer removal and failed to consider the child's best interests
Evidence_Assessment: Prior PRRA rejection, incomplete H&C application, risks assessed
Decision_Outcome: Refusal to defer removal was not patently unreasonable
Legal_Rule: Section 48 of IRPA mandates immediate removal unless deferral is reasonably practicable; removal officers have limited discretion considering health, safety, or pending H&C applications
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider child’s best interests
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged risks and misplaced H&C application
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application dismissed; no certification of broader legal question
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer considered child’s best interest through family unity in Albania
Key_Evidence_Considered: Prior PRRA decision, status of H&C application, risk assessment, family unity
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking deferral of removal based on risks and humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds
Defendant_Response: Removal officer concluded no new substantial risks existed
Evidence_Type: Administrative records, H&C application status, PRRA outcome
Outcome: Removal not deferred; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Sought: Deferral of removal based on child's best interests and H&C considerations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-compliance with immigration requirements, lack of successful H&C application
Applicable_Process: Removal process with potential for deferral under H&C or risk grounds
